PageTitle: display bgp link-state unicast routing-table (All views)
FuncDef: The display bgp link-state unicast routing-table command displays BGP-LS route information.
CLIs: display bgp link-state unicast routing-table [ peer { <ipv4-address> | <ipv6-address> } { received-routes | advertised-routes } ] <bgp-ls-prefix>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the address of the IPv4 peer to be displayed.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the address of the IPv6 peer to be displayed.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays BGP-LS routes received from the specified peer.
-

Displays BGP-LS routes advertised to the specified peer.
-

Specifies a BGP-LS route prefix.
For details about BGP-LS route prefix formats, see "BGP-LS" in Feature Description - IP Routing - BGP.
The BGP-LS route prefix format is complex. To facilitate your query, run the display bgp link-state unicast routing-table command to check all BGP-LS routes, and copy the prefix of the route whose information is to be queried when specifying prefix.

Examples: BGP routing table entry information of [NODE][ISIS-LEVEL-1][IDENTIFIER0][LOCAL[as100][bgp-ls-identifier1.1.1.3][ospf-area-id0.0.0.0][igp-router-id0000.0000.0001.00]]:
AS-path 100, origin incomplete, MED 0, pref-val 0, valid, external, best, select, pre 255
IPv4 Router ID of Local Node:
IPv6 Router ID of Local Node:
SR Local Block(Flags/[Range Size, Sid Value]): <0x00/[12000,20001]>
Not advertised to any peer yet

BGP routing table entry information of [LINK][ISIS-LEVEL-1][IDENTIFIER0][LOCAL[as100][bgp-ls-identifier10.5.1.1][ospf-area-id0.0.0.0][igp-router-id0000.0000.0003.00]][REMOTE[as100][bgp-ls-identifier10.5.1.1][ospf-area-id0.0.0.0][igp-router-id0000.0000.0001.00]][LINK[if-address0.0.0.0][peer-address0.0.0.0][if-address::][peer-address::]]:
AS-path Nil, origin incomplete, MED 0, localpref 100, pref-val 0, valid, internal, best, select, pre 255, IGP cost 10
IPv4 Router ID of Local Node:

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check BGP-LS route information, run the display bgp link-state unicast routing-table command. BGP-LS routes carry topology information and are classified into four types of routes that carry node, link, route prefix, and TE Policy information, respectively. Theses routes collaborate in carrying topology information.
